# Valuation Model: Open ToDos

- Check the Data retrieval from yfinance: The numbers, e.g. for the Balancesheet, are wrong and identical across each company! And the data is not the same 
as on the webpage --> the transformation of the list of dictionaries into a dataframe with pd.melt() might cause this problem. Initially, when you retrieve data from yfinance, you get float point data value for each item with e10, etc.; but the functions return a dataframe with integer numbers that are simply wrong...

- Once you have corrected that mistake, rerun that script and re-establish the database.
